title: slowcooker chicken soup to soothe a weary soul
summary: Slowcooker chicken soup to soothe a weary soul might be just the main course you are searching for. For $1.02 per serving, this recipe covers 20% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One portion of this dish contains around 18g of protein, 13g of fat, and a total of 252 calories. This recipe serves 8. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. Autumn will be even more special with this recipe. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, dairy free, and whole 30 diet. A mixture of bay leafs, chicken, ground pepper, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so scrumptious. To use up the unrefined sea salt you could follow this main course with the Coconut Custard as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 23 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 61%. This score is pretty good. Try Chicken Soup for the Soul, Green Chicken Soup for the Soul, and Chicken Barley Soup For The Soul for similar recipes.
instructions: Rinse the chicken, inside and out, then pat it dry and season it well with unrefined sea salt and ground black pepper.Place the chicken in a slowcooker with leeks and bay leafs then cover with water.  Cook on low for twelve hours.Add chopped onion, carrots, celery and potatoes to the slowcooker and continue cooking on low for an additional six to eight hours.Stir in parsley, pick out large bones and serve.

steps.step: Rinse the chicken, inside and out, then pat it dry and season it well with unrefined sea salt and ground black pepper.
Place the chicken in a slowcooker with leeks and bay leafs then cover with water.  Cook on low for twelve hours.
Add chopped onion, carrots, celery and potatoes to the slowcooker and continue cooking on low for an additional six to eight hours.Stir in parsley, pick out large bones and serve.
